entry.name: ZertoAppliance_VRAs
entry.technology:
Device Properties:
zertoappliance.host -- Optional, defaults to the device IP when not set. zertoappliance.port -- Optional, defaults to 443 (Linux), set 9669 for Windows appliances. zertoappliance.user -- The user name (in the UPN or NetBIOS form as necessary), used with the Windows appliance. zertoappliance.pass -- The user password, used with the Windows appliance. zertoappliance.api.id -- The client ID, used with the Linux appliance. zertoappliance.api.key -- The client secret, used with the Linux appliance. zertoappliance.type -- Optional, forces the appliance type if required, set either "windows" or "linux". system.categories -- Add "ZertoAppliance".
Notes:
Requires access to the API endpoint on the ZVM or ZCM appliance. See the "ZertoAppliance_Token" DataSource for details.
This DataSource is not applicable when using a Zerto Cloud Manager (ZCM).

attribute.name: scriptgroovy
__filter_0
attribute.comment: ZCAs appear as "N/A" in a Cloud setup as they manage replication traffic not VRAs

datapoint.name: VraAlertsStatus
datapoint.alertbody:
The Zerto VRA ##INSTANCE## on ##HOST## has reported an alert status of ##VALUE##, placing the resource into a ##LEVEL## level.
This started at ##START##, -- or ##DURATION## ago.
Status codes: 0=Normal 1=Warning 2=Error
datapoint.description:
The VRA alert status.
Status codes: 0=Normal 1=Warning 2=Error
